channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Navigating new territory: Covid, vaccines and relationships
item.description: As Aucklanders begin to meet up with family and friends outside, vaccinated people are having to decide if they want to see people who aren't, leading to some new conversations.

item.title: Super Saturday Vaxathon sees biggest-ever one-day vaccine update for Māori
item.description: Health officials say 84 percent of people in this country have now had their first Pfizer dose after yesterday's Vaxathon.

item.title: Thousands respond to government's vaccination drive
item.description: The Super Saturday Vaxathon that has seen around 130,000 people vaccinated in one day has exceeded expectations, the prime minister says.

item.title: Three die in boating tragedy on Manukau Harbour
item.description: Three people are dead and a fourth is in hospital after a boat flipped at Auckland's Manukau Harbour.

item.title: Pacific community makes super vaccination effort
item.description: There was a street festival vibe to many Pasifika-organised Vaxathon events around the country.

item.title: 'Not just a respiratory virus' - Long Covid warnings for unvaxxed
item.description: It's not just the immediate hospitalisations but the dangers of long Covid that are a cause for worry as cases increase, Professor John Potter tells Kim Hill.

item.title: Third woman who travelled to Northland tests positive
item.description: A third woman, who was with the two women who travelled to Northland, has tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Social media presence pays dividends in vaccine drive
item.description: Reaching out on social media is helping to boost the number of Pasifika vaccinated in the top of the South Island.

item.title: Recap Covid-19 updates: Super Saturday Vaxathon
item.description: Aotearoa has easily reached the government's 'Super Saturday' goal of 100,000 vaccine doses today, sliding past the target figure at 3pm this afternoon. Follow all the latest news and developments here.

item.title: Covid-19 update: 41 new community cases reported in NZ today
item.description: There are 41 new community cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today as the country tries to push vaccination rates up on Super Saturday.

item.title: Driver assaulted before tavern courtesy van taken
item.description: Police are appealing for information after a courtesy van was taken and its driver assaulted in Central Otago earlier today.

item.title: Driver dies after truck rolls off road
item.description: A truck driver has died after his vehicle overturned and went down a bank on State Highway 2, Remutaka Hill, between the Hutt Valley and Wairarapa.

item.title: Students living in Victoria University accommodation will need to be fully vaccinated
item.description: Arrangements for students who can't be vaccinated on medical grounds - and provide eviedence they meet Ministry of Health guidance on this - will be discussed on a case by case basis.

item.title: Man, 24, charged with attempted murder after Otago shooting
item.description: A man has been charged with attempted murder in relation to a shooting in Karitane, Dunedin yesterday and been remanded in custody.

item.title: 'It's going to be a great day' - Dr Bloomfield set for Super Saturday
item.description: Director-General of Health Dr Ashley Bloomfield is throwing his weight behind today's Super Saturday national vaccination push, saying that there's an "element of generosity" in protecting everyone from Covid-19.

item.title: Man charged with murder after Ōmāpere death
item.description: A man has been charged with murder after police found another man dead at a house in Ōmāpere.

item.title: Super Saturday vaccinations: 1000 Chiefs tickets up for grabs in Waikato
item.description: Sixty-six pop-up Covid-19 vaccination sites will be open across the Waikato DHB region, which includes King Country and Coromandel for Super Saturday.

item.title: Man charged with attempted murder after Nelson stabbing
item.description: A man has been been charged with attempted murder after a stabbing in Nelson.
